level.heading: Fixing amount necessary for redemption after action to foreclose filed.

level.text: If there is a dispute regarding redemption after an action to foreclose the right of redemption is filed, the person redeeming may apply to the Superior Court for an order fixing the amount necessary for redemption in accordance with the provisions of this chapter.
Except as provided in subsection (c) of this section, the Mayor may accept a payment for redemption without an order of court.
Repealed.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2014 amendment by D.C. Law 20-141, repealed before its effective date, would have substituted "If there is a dispute regarding redemption after an action to foreclose the right of redemption is filed, the" for "If the real property is redeemed after an action to foreclose the right of redemption is filed and there is a dispute regarding redemption, the" in (a); and repealed (c).

The 2015 amendment by D.C. Law 20-155 substituted "If there is a dispute regarding redemption after an action to foreclose the right of redemption is filed" for "If the real property is redeemed after an action to foreclose the right of redemption is filed and there is a dispute regarding redemption" in (a); and repealed (c).
